meanings.definition: To write again, especially in a different way.
meanings.sent1: She is rewriting her essay to make it better.
meanings.sent2: I enjoy rewriting stories to give them a new twist.
meanings.sent3: The student kept rewriting the same sentence over and over, trying to improve it.
meanings.sent4: Her life felt like a book that needed rewriting, with new chapters waiting to be written.
meanings.sent5: The author's rewriting of the classic tale breathed fresh life into the story.

meanings.definition: The act of revising or editing written material.
meanings.sent1: Rewriting is an essential part of the writing process.
meanings.sent2: The rewriting of the manuscript took longer than expected.
meanings.sent3: The rewriting of the play turned it into a comedy instead of a drama.
meanings.sent4: In the world of literature, rewriting is like sculpting a masterpiece from a block of marble.
meanings.sent5: The rewriting of the contract clarified the terms for both parties.
